member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsArray.splice(SharpKit.JavaScript.JsNumber,SharpKit.JavaScript.JsNumber,System.Object[])
member.summary: Removes elements from an array and, if necessary, inserts new elements in their place, returning the deleted elements. Returns the elements removed from the array.
member.param: Required. The zero-based location in the array from which to start removing elements.
Required. The number of elements to remove.
Optional. Elements to insert into the array in place of the deleted elements.
member.remarks: The splice method modifies the array by removing the specified number of elements from position start and inserting new elements. The deleted elements are returned as a new array object.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsArray.slice(SharpKit.JavaScript.JsNumber,SharpKit.JavaScript.JsNumber)
member.summary: Returns a section of an array.
member.param: Required. The index to the beginning of the specified portion of the array.
Optional. The index to the end of the specified portion of the array.
member.remarks: The slice method returns an Array object containing the specified portion of the array. The slice method copies up to, but not including, the element indicated by end. If start is negative, it is treated as length + start where length is the length of the array. If end is negative, it is treated as length + end where length is the length of the array. If end is omitted, extraction continues to the end of the array. If end occurs before start, no elements are copied to the new array.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsObjectBase.watch(SharpKit.JavaScript.JsString,System.Action)
member.summary: Watches for a property to be assigned a value and runs a function when that occurs. Watches for assignment to a property named prop in this object, calling handler(prop, oldval, newval) whenever prop is set and storing the return value in that property. A watchpoint can filter (or nullify) the value assignment, by returning a modified newval (or by returning oldval). If you delete a property for which a watchpoint has been set, that watchpoint does not disappear. If you later recreate the property, the watchpoint is still in effect. To remove a watchpoint, use the unwatch method. By default, the watch method is inherited by every object descended from Object. The JavaScript debugger has functionality similar to that provided by this method, as well as other debugging options. For information on the debugger, see Venkman. In NES 3.0 and 4.x, handler is called from native code as well as assignments in script. In Firefox, handler is only called from assignments in script, not from native code. For example, window.watch('location', myHandler) will not call myHandler if the user clicks a link to an anchor within the current document. However, window.location += '#myAnchor' will call myHandler:
member.param: The name of a property of the object.
A function to call.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsObjectBase.unwatch(SharpKit.JavaScript.JsString)
member.summary: Removes a watchpoint set with the watch method The JavaScript debugger has functionality similar to that provided by this method, as well as other debugging options. For information on the debugger, see Venkman. By default, this method is inherited by every object descended from Object.
member.param: The name of a property of the object.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsObjectBase.valueOf
member.summary: Returns the primitive value of the specified object. The required object reference is any intrinsic JScript object. The valueOf method is defined differently for each intrinsic JScript object. Object Return Value Array Returns the array instance. Boolean The Boolean value. Date The stored time value in milliseconds since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC. Function The function itself. Number The numeric value. Object The object itself. This is the default. String The JsString value. The Math and Error objects do not have a valueOf method.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsObjectBase.isPrototypeOf(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether an object exists in another object's prototype chain.
member.param: Another object whose prototype chain is to be checked.
member.returns: true if object2 has object1 in its prototype chain. The prototype chain is used to share functionality between instances of the same object type. The isPrototypeOf method returns false when object2 is not an object or when object1 does not appear in the prototype chain of the object2.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsObjectBase.hasOwnProperty(SharpKit.JavaScript.JsString)
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether an object has a property with the specified name.
member.param: String value of a property name.
member.returns: true if object has a property of the specified name, false if it does not. This method does not check if the property exists in the object's prototype chain; the property must be a member of the object itself.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsObjectBase.toString

member.returns: Returns "[object objectname]", where objectname is the name of the object type.

member.summary: Returns an integer converted from a JsString.

member.summary: Returns an integer converted from a JsString.
member.param: A JsString to convert into a number.

A value between 2 and 36 indicating the base of the number contained in numString. If not supplied, strings with a prefix of '0x' are considered hexadecimal and strings with a prefix of '0' are considered octal. All other strings are considered decimal.
member.returns: An integer value equal to the number contained in numString. If no prefix of numString can be successfully parsed into an integer, NaN (not a number) is returned.

member.summary: Returns an integer converted from a JsString.
member.param: A JsString to convert into a number.

A value between 2 and 36 indicating the base of the number contained in numString. If not supplied, strings with a prefix of '0x' are considered hexadecimal and strings with a prefix of '0' are considered octal. All other strings are considered decimal.
member.returns: An integer value equal to the number contained in numString. If no prefix of numString can be successfully parsed into an integer, NaN (not a number) is returned.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsContextBase.delete(System.Object)
member.summary: Deletes a property from an object, or removes an element from an array.
member.returns: The expression argument is a valid JavaScript expression that usually results in a property name or array element. If the result of expression is an object, the property specified in expression exists, and the object will not allow it to be deleted, false is returned. In all other cases, true is returned.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate.getFullYear
member.summary: Returns the year value in the Date object using local time.
member.returns: the year as an absolute number. For example, the year 1976 is returned as 1976.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate.getMonth
member.summary: Returns the month value in the Date object using local time.
member.returns: integer between 0 and 11 indicating the month value in the Date object. The integer returned is not the traditional number used to indicate the month. It is one less. If "Jan 5, 1996 08:47:00" is stored in a Date object, getMonth returns 0.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate.getDate
member.summary: Returns the day-of-the-month value in a Date object using local time.
member.returns: an integer between 1 and 31 that represents the day-of-the-month value in the Date object.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate.getHours
member.summary: Returns the hours value in a Date object using local time.
member.returns: an integer between 0 and 23, indicating the number of hours since midnight. A zero occurs in two situations: the time is before 1:00:00 am, or the time was not stored in the Date object when the object was created. The only way to determine which situation you have is to also check the minutes and seconds for zero values. If they are all zeroes, it is nearly certain that the time was not stored in the Date object.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate.getMinutes
member.summary: Returns the minutes value in a Date object using local time.
member.returns: integer between 0 and 59 equal to the minutes value stored in the Date object. A zero is returned in two situations: when the time is less than one minute after the hour, or when the time was not stored in the Date object when the object was created. The only way to determine which situation you have is to also check the hours and seconds for zero values. If they are all zeroes, it is nearly certain that the time was not stored in the Date object.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate.getSeconds
member.summary: Returns the seconds value in a Date object using local time.
member.returns: integer between 0 and 59 indicating the seconds value of the indicated Date object. A zero is returned in two situations. One occurs when the time is less than one second into the current minute. The other occurs when the time was not stored in the Date object when the object was created. The only way to determine which situation you have is to also check the hours and minutes for zero values. If they are all zeroes, it is nearly certain that the time was not stored in the Date object.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate.getMilliseconds
member.summary: Returns the milliseconds value in a Date object using local time.
member.returns: The millisecond value returned can range from 0-999.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate.toLocaleDateString
member.summary: Returns a date as a JsString value appropriate to the host environment's current locale.
member.returns: A JsString value that contains a date, in the current time zone, in an easily read format. The date is in the default format of the host environment's current locale. The return value of this method cannot be relied upon in scripting, as it will vary from computer to computer. The toLocaleDateString method should only be used to format display never as part of a computation.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate.UTC(SharpKit.JavaScript.JsNumber,SharpKit.JavaScript.JsNumber,SharpKit.JavaScript.JsNumber)
member.summary: Returns the number of milliseconds between midnight, January 1, 1970 Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) (or GMT) and the supplied date.
member.param: The full year designation is required for cross-century date accuracy. If year is between 0 and 99 is used, then year is assumed to be 1900 + year.
The month as an integer between 0 and 11 (January to December).
The date as an integer between 1 and 31.
member.returns: The number of milliseconds between midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC and the supplied date. This return value can be used in the setTime method and in the Date object constructor. If the value of an argument is greater than its range, or is a negative number, other stored values are modified accordingly. For example, if you specify 150 seconds, JScript redefines that number as two minutes and 30 seconds.

For example, if you specify 150 seconds, JScript redefines that number as two minutes and 30 seconds.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate.getTimezoneOffset

If it is called from a server script, the return value is appropriate to the server. If it is called from a client script, the return value is appropriate to the client.

member.returns: An integer between 0 and 59 equal to the number of minutes value in the Date object. A zero occurs in two situations: the time is less than one minute after the hour, or a time was not stored in the Date object when the object was created. The only way to determine which situation you have is to also check the hours and seconds for zero values. If they are all zeroes, it is nearly certain that the time was not stored in the Date object.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate.getUTCMonth
member.summary: Returns the month value in a Date object using Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
member.returns: An integer between 0 and 11 indicating the month value in the Date object. The integer returned is not the traditional number used to indicate the month. It is one less. If "Jan 5, 1996 08:47:00.0" is stored in a Date object, getUTCMonth returns 0.

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate.getUTCSeconds
member.summary: Returns the seconds value in a Date object using Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
member.returns: An integer between 0 and 59 indicating the seconds value of the indicated Date object. A zero occurs in two situations: the time is less than one second into the current minute, or a time was not stored in the Date object when the object was created. The only way to determine which situation you have is to also check the minutes and hours for zero values. If they are all zeroes, it is nearly certain that the time was not stored in the Date object..

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate.getYear
member.summary: Returns the year value in a Date object. This method is obsolete, and is provided for backwards compatibility only. Use the getFullYear method instead. For the years 1900 though 1999, the year is a 2-digit integer value returned as the difference between the stored year and 1900. For dates outside that period, the 4-digit year is returned. For example, 1996 is returned as 96, but 1825 and 2025 are returned as-is.

member.returns: An integer value representing the number of milliseconds between midnight, January 1, 1970 and the date supplied in dateVal.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsError.description
member.summary: Returns or sets the descriptive JsString associated with a specific error.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsError.message
member.summary: Returns an error message JsString.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsError.name
member.summary: Returns the name of an error. When a runtime error occurs, the name property is set to one of the following native exception types: ConversionError This error occurs whenever there is an attempt to convert an object into something to which it cannot be converted. RangeError This error occurs when a function is supplied with an argument that has exceeded its allowable range. For example, this error occurs if you attempt to construct an Array object with a length that is not a valid positive integer. ReferenceError This error occurs when an invalid reference has been detected. This error will occur, for example, if an expected reference is null. RegExpError This error occurs when a compilation error occurs with a regular expression. Once the regular expression is compiled, however, this error cannot occur. This example will occur, for example, when a regular expression is declared with a pattern that has an invalid syntax, or flags other than i, g, or m, or if it contains the same flag more than once. SyntaxError This error occurs when source text is parsed and that source text does not follow correct syntax. This error will occur, for example, if the eval function is called with an argument that is not valid program text. TypeError This error occurs whenever the actual type of an operand does not match the expected type. An example of when this error occurs is a function call made on something that is not an object or does not support the call. URIError This error occurs when an illegal Uniform Resource Indicator (URI) is detected. For example, this is error occurs when an illegal character is found in a JsString being encoded or decoded.

member.name: T:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsRegExp
member.summary: An object that contains a regular expression pattern along with flags that identify how to apply the pattern. re = /pattern/[flags] re = new RegExp("pattern"[,"flags"])

member.name: M:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsRegExp.exec(SharpKit.JavaScript.JsString)
member.summary: If the exec method does not find a match, it returns null. If it finds a match, exec returns an array, and the properties of the global RegExp object are updated to reflect the results of the match. Element zero of the array contains the entire match, while elements 1 n contain any submatches that have occurred within the match. This behavior is identical to the behavior of the match method without the global flag (g) set. If the global flag is set for a regular expression, exec searches the JsString beginning at the position indicated by the value of lastIndex. If the global flag is not set, exec ignores the value of lastIndex and searches from the beginning of the JsString.
member.param: The String object or JsString literal on which to perform the search

member.name: F:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsRegExpResult.lastParen

member.name: F:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsRegExpResult.leftContext
member.summary: Returns the characters from the beginning of a searched JsString up to the position before the beginning of the last match. Read-only.

member.name: F:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsRegExpResult.rightContext
member.summary: Returns the characters from the position following the last match to the end of the searched JsString. Read-only.

member.name: T:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute

member.summary: Creates an instance of a JsTypeAttribute

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.PreCode

member.summary: Js code that will be written after exporting the type

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.OrderInFile
member.summary: Precendece between JsTypes in the same file, negative values will put the type before other types, and positive value will put it after other types

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.TargetType
member.summary: When used as assembly attribute, indicates the type for which to apply this attribute on. This feature should be used when trying to describe classes on external assemblies that has no SharpKit support

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.TargetTypeName
member.summary: When used as assembly attribute, indicates the type for which to apply this attribute on. This feature should be used when trying to describe classes on external assemblies that has no SharpKit support

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.NativeParams
member.summary: When set to true - SharpKit will ignore all params[] keywords in all methods

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.NativeDelegates
member.summary: Indicates that all delegate parameters in all members are native javascript functions

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.OmitCasts
member.summary: When true, omits all casts to this type

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.PropertiesAsFields
member.summary: Forces all properties to be treated as JavaScript native fields without any getter and setter methods

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.AutomaticPropertiesAsFields
member.summary: Forces all automatic properties to be treated as JavaScript native fields without any getter and setter methods

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.NativeEnumerator
member.summary: When true, foreach statements will use the for..in syntax of Javascript

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.NativeArrayEnumerator
member.summary: When true, foreach statements will use the for loop syntax of Javascript

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.NativeConstructors
member.summary: When true, instanciations of this class will use the native Javascript method, rather than calling a constructor

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.NativeOverloads
member.summary: When true, instanciations of this class will use the native Javascript method, rather than calling a constructor

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.NativeOperatorOverloads
member.summary: When true, operator overloads will be exported as native js binary operations: if System.Int32 has a '/' operator overload then: x / y -> System.Int32.op_div(x, y); //NativeOperatorOverloads=false x / y -> x / y; //NativeOperatorOverloads=true

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.Native
member.summary: Indicates that this type will be exported as native js type, only one constructor is allowed, all instance members will be exported to the constructor's prototype all static members will be exported to the constructor's members

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.GlobalObject
member.summary: When set, the class methods and properties will be declared on the window object, instead of a class.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.NativeFunctions
member.summary: Any anonymous delegate creation will be exported as a native inline function in javascript

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.NativeJsons
member.summary: Anonymous objects will be created and treated as Json objects

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.Export
member.summary: Indicates that SharpKit compiler will generate javascript code for this type / member This property is inherited and applied to all derived types. Default value is true

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.Name
member.summary: When set, changes the type name in the client code

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.Filename
member.summary: The target filename to generate the javascript code into, when using a relative path, it will be relative to the current cs file, You may use the ~ (tilda) operator to designate the project directory

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.Exporter
member.summary: The type of js exporter to use

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.IgnoreGenericTypeArguments
member.summary: Omits and ignores any generic type argument

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.IgnoreGenericMethodArguments
member.summary: Omits and ignores any generic argument in any method inside the class (Equivalent to JsMethod(IgnoreGenericArguments=true) on each method)

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.Mode
member.summary: Controls the JavaScript mode of this type, a mode is a combination of several boolean settings of the JsTypeAttribute

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.ForceDelegatesAsNativeFunctions
member.summary: Forces any delegate used in the current type to be created a native js function without an instance context

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.InlineFields
member.summary: Declares fields and PropertiesAsFields in object definition, and does not move them to the constructor

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.OmitOptionalParameters
member.summary: Omits optional parameters in methods, when not sent by caller

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.OmitInheritance
member.summary: Specifies whether or not to declare inheritance of a class to a base class

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.OmitDefaultConstructor
member.summary: When set to true, if no instance constructor was defined in this class, no constructor will be generated. This is helpful when extending existing classes, and avoiding overwriting existing constructors

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.SharpKitVersion
member.summary: Targets the attribute for a specific SharpKit version, this attribute will be ignored if the current SharpKit version isn't in the range of the value specified

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.PrototypeName
P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.NativeCasts
member.summary: When set to true, casting/as/is will be generated using the native "instanceof" keyword

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.NativeProperties
member.summary: When true, Object.defineProperty is used for properties. The browser needs to support native property.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.NativePropertiesEnumerable
member.summary: The NativePropertyEnumerable property attribute defines whether the property shows up in a for...in loop and Object.keys() or not.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.NativeError
member.summary: Treats the class as a native "Error" object and prevents smart exception throwing

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsTypeAttribute.GenericArgumentJsCode
member.summary: The JavaScript code that will be generated when this type is passed as a generic argument to a generic method or generic type

member.name: T:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMode
member.summary: Specifies the export and interoperability mode of a C# type in JavaScript

member.name: F:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMode.Global
member.summary: Specifies a global function export mode, in which only static members are allowed, static methods become global functions static fields become global variables static constrctor becomes global code

member.name: F:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMode.Prototype
member.summary: Specifies a prototype object export mode, in which a single constructor is allowed, and both static and instance members. constructor becomes a constructor function instance members become the equivalent members on the constructor function's prototype. static members become members on the constructor function itself.

member.name: F:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMode.Clr
member.summary: Specifies a .NET style class, in which all C# elements are supported, this mode requires JsClr library to be included on the client at runtime.

member.name: F:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMode.Json
member.summary: Specifies an invisible unexported json type, this class will not be exported, instantiation and usage of classes in this mode, will be exported to simple json elements.

member.name: T:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute
member.summary: Provides information regarding how SharpKit will export JavaScript code

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.ExportComments
member.summary: Specifies whether to include C# comments in the JavaScript code

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.Minify
member.summary: Specifies whether SharpKit should minify the exported files

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.LongFunctionNames
member.summary: Instructs SharpKit to provide any exported function with a global unique name, to help debugging of client side code.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.EnableProfiler
member.summary: Injects profiling code into JavaScript functions to enable performance profiling.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.FilenameFormat
member.summary: Specifies prefix / suffix to any filename exported by SharpKit, e.g.: FilenameFormat="js/{0}"

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.DefaultFilename
member.summary: Specifies default js filename for all types that didn't specify a specific js file for export If not specified, default file will be res/[AssemblyName].js

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.DefaultFilenameAsCsFilename
member.summary: Specifies to use the .cs filename for all types that didn't specify a specific js file for export, MyTextBox.cs -> MyTextBox.js

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.PreCodeInjectionFilename
member.summary: Specifies to inject all available helper methods generated by SharpKit into a single separate file, this feature is supported by SharpKit 5 only.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.PostCodeInjectionFilename
member.summary: Specifies to inject all helper method invocations generated by SharpKit into a single separate file, this feature is supported by SharpKit 5 only.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.GenerateSourceMaps
member.summary:
Specifies to generate chrome source maps, which enables debugging of JavaScript in C#. To enable this feature you must add a handler in your web.config file:
<add name="SourceMapsHandler" type="SharpKit.Web.Server.Handlers.SourceMapsHandler, SharpKit.Web" verb="*" path="SourceMaps.ashx" />
And enable source maps in chrome: show development bar, click options wheel, check enable source maps.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.UseExactEquals
P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.UseStrict
member.summary: Uses the ECMAScript5 strict mode.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.OmitSharpKitHeaderComment
member.summary: Removes the 'Generated by SharpKit 5 v...' header comment in js files

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.AddTimeStampInSharpKitHeaderComment
member.summary: Add the generation time to the sharpkit header comment. CAUTION: This will change your file's content on every compilation. This could occur unnecessary conflics with version control software!

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.ForceOmitCasts
member.summary: Overrides all OmitCasts definitions in the assembly, and skips any code generation for casting

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.JsCodeFormat
member.summary: Options are "JavaScript"/null (default) for default js style, or C#/CSharp for C# style

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsExportAttribute.ForceIntegers
member.summary: Forces integers to remain as integers when casting or using binary operations, by adding (|0) to these expressions

member.summary: The source files to merge

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMergedFileAttribute.Filename
member.summary: The target merged file name

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMergedFileAttribute.Minify

member.name: T:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute
member.summary: Specifies custom instructions for SharpKit for a single method, this information is used when exporting the member, and when using it.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.NativeParams
member.summary: When set to true, SharpKit will ignore the params[] keyword on the method parameter

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.TargetMethod
member.summary: Applies the attribute externally on a method, if the method has overloads, attribute will be applied on all of them

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.TargetType
member.summary: Applies the attribute externally on a type

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.TargetTypeName
member.summary: Applies the attribute externally on a type

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.OmitCalls
member.summary: Tells the compiler to omit calls to this method and assume that it was invoked Extension methods: s.DoSomething() ==> s

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.Name
member.summary: Instructs SharpKit to use a custom name for a method, SharpKit will use this name when exporting the method, and when invoking it.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.InlineCode
member.summary: Tells the compiler to drop the method call and write the inline code instead. Only available for extention methods. object.SomeExtentionMethod(param) with InlineCode="object==param" ==> object==param

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.Code
member.summary: Custom javascript code implementation for this method

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.NativeOverloads
member.summary: When set to true - disables the overloading mechanism and assumes that the overloads are implemented in a single javascript method with this name

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.IgnoreGenericArguments
member.summary: Ignores the generic arguments passed to a method when invoking it in JavaScript

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.ExtensionImplementedInInstance
member.summary: Marks this extension method as an instance method in javascript

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.NativeDelegates
member.summary: Treats delegates inside this method as native javascript functions.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.ForceDelegatesAsNativeFunctions
member.summary: Forces any delegate used in the current method to be created a native js function without an instance context

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.GlobalCode
member.summary: Generates the method code as global JavaScript code, without any function

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.Global
member.summary: Indicates that this method is global, if exported, it will be exported as a global function, and when invoked, it will be invoked without a class name prefix

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.Export
member.summary: Indicates that SharpKit compiler will generate javascript code for this type / member This property is inherited and applied to all derived types. Default value is true

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.OmitParanthesis
member.summary: Omits the paranthesis () when invoking this method, used for javascript keywords (e.g.: delete)

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.OmitDotOperator
member.summary: Omits the dot (.) operator before the instance name, when invoking this method, used for javascript keywords (e.g.: instanceof)

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.OmitOptionalParameters
member.summary: Omits optional parameters, when not sent by caller

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.OmitNewOperator
member.summary: Omits the new operator when creating new instances on a consutrctor

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.InstanceImplementedAsExtension
member.summary: Allows an instance method to be invoke like an extension method x.Call() -> Call(x)

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.ArgumentsPrefix
P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.ArgumentsSuffix
P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.InsertArg0
member.summary: Inserts a custom argument when invoking the function

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.InsertArg1
member.summary: Inserts a custom argument when invoking the function

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.InsertArg2
member.summary: Inserts a custom argument when invoking the function

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.OmitCommas
member.summary: Causes the function to be invoked without any commas between arguments: x.Call(a,b,c) -> x.Call(abc);

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.JsonInitializers
member.summary: Sends initializers to constructor as a parameter: Collection initializers as Json arrays Object initializers as a Json object Important note: a new json / array object will ALWAYS be passed to the constructor, even if no object initializers are passed.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.SharpKitVersion
member.summary: Targets the attribute for a specific SharpKit version, this attribute will be ignored if the current SharpKit version isn't in the range of the value specified

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsMethodAttribute.InlineCodeExpression
member.summary: Manual code expression inlining, SharpKit will parse this code, and replace the parameters with the real code passed to the function, allowing to customize the way the invocation code is generated

member.summary: When set, all references will not use getters and setter, but will treat it as a field instead

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsPropertyAttribute.NativeIndexer
member.summary: When applied to an indexer property, all references will not use getters and setter, but will treat it as a native indexer instead

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsPropertyAttribute.Export
member.summary: Indicates that SharpKit compiler will generate javascript code for this type / member This property is inherited and applied to all derived types. Default value is true

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsPropertyAttribute.TargetProperty
member.summary: Applies the attribute externally on a property

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsPropertyAttribute.TargetType
member.summary: Applies the attribute externally on a type

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsPropertyAttribute.TargetTypeName
member.summary: Applies the attribute externally on a type

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsPropertyAttribute.Global
member.summary: Sets a static property as a global property - omits the class name when declaring and invoking the property

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsPropertyAttribute.NativeProperty
member.summary: When true, Object.defineProperty is used for properties. The browser needs to support native property.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsPropertyAttribute.NativePropertyEnumerable
member.summary: The NativePropertyEnumerable property attribute defines whether the property shows up in a for...in loop and Object.keys() or not.

member.name: T:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsEventAttribute

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsEventAttribute.NativeDelegates

member.summary: Specifies custom instructions for SharpKit for a delegate, this information is used when exporting the member, and when using it.

member.summary: Causes a delegate to be treated as a native JavaScript function

member.summary: Causes a delegate to be treated as a native JavaScript function without instance context support, this means that any instance context using the 'this' keyword will be lost

member.summary: When type is exported, the value of every enum member will be its string name representation, and not its numeric value

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsEnumAttribute.TargetType
member.summary: When used as assembly attribute, indicates the type for which to apply this attribute on. This feature should be used when trying to describe classes on external assemblies that has no SharpKit support

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsEnumAttribute.TargetTypeName
member.summary: When used as assembly attribute, indicates the type for which to apply this attribute on. This feature should be used when trying to describe classes on external assemblies that has no SharpKit support

member.name: T:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsFieldAttribute
member.summary: Specifies custom instructions for SharpKit for a property, this information is used when exporting the member, and when using it.

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsFieldAttribute.Export
member.summary: Indicates that SharpKit compiler will generate javascript code for this field This property is inherited and applied to all derived types. Default value is true

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsFieldAttribute.Name
member.summary: Instructs SharpKit to use a custom name for this field, SharpKit will use this name when exporting the field, and when using it in code.

member.name: T:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsNamespaceAttribute
member.summary: Allows mapping and replacement between C# and JavaScript namespace. Useful for creating shorter namespaces in JavaScript

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsNamespaceAttribute.Namespace
member.summary: The C# namespace to be mapped (cannot be null or empty)

member.name: P:SharpKit.JavaScript.JsNamespaceAttribute.JsNamespace
member.summary: The JavaScript namespace that should be replaced (can be empty, not recommended)

member.name: T:AssemblyDoc
member.summary: SharpKit core assembly, contains all needed attributes and types required to use SharpKit
